text: Jelle Zijlstra (Augustus 27, 1918 in Oosterbierum - December 23, 2001 in Wassenaar) was a Dutch economist and a politician of the Anti-Revolutionary Party (ARP). Zijlstra studied economics at the Erasmus University Rotterdam and was a economics professor at the Free University Amsterdam. He was prime minister from 1966 to 1967. He was also a government minister, a member- parliamentary leader of the Second Chamber and a member of the First Chamber. After his political career he was president of De Nederlandsche Bank, the Dutch central bank. Zijlstra was a Reformed Christian. He died in 2001, aged 83. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1918 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Anti-Revolutionary Party politicians Category:Dutch bankers Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch Calvinists Category:Dutch economists Category:Leaders of political parties in the Netherlands Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Members of the Senate of the Netherlands Category:Government ministers of the Netherlands Category:Politicians from Friesland Category:Prime ministers of the Netherlands
title: Jelle Zijlstra
